definition: to adopt an attitude/to strike a posture
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: The posturing before the camera on bothe sides repelled me.
sentences.chinese: 雙方在攝像機前裝腔作勢的姿態令我作嘔。

sentences.english: The posturing before the camera on both sides repelled me.
sentences.chinese: 雙方在攝像機前裝腔作勢的姿態令我作嘔。

sentences.english: Depending upon heroics to get your product out the door is simply bad program management.
sentences.chinese: 讓裝腔作勢使你的產品出局是最糟糕的項目管理。

sentences.english: People can smell a poser from a mile away.
sentences.chinese: 人們在一英里之外都可以聞到裝腔作勢的人的氣味。

sentences.english: He behaved like our equal, without any haughtiness , putting on airs or something like that.
sentences.chinese: 他的舉動是那樣的親切，一點也不傲慢或者裝腔作勢。

sentences.english: Behavior characteristic is self- dramatizing , mincing.
sentences.chinese: 行爲特點是自吹自擂，裝腔作勢。

sentences.english: He's a poseur and never actually writes anything.
sentences.chinese: 他們是裝腔作勢的人，實際上從來不寫任何東西。

sentences.english: In this phase, the shouts and histrionics will abate somewhat.
sentences.chinese: 在這個階段，大呼小叫和裝腔作勢都將減少。

sentences.english: Paris,--let us confess it--willingly allows infamy to furnish it with comedy.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該承認巴黎心甘情願讓無恥在那兒裝腔作勢。

sentences.english: Stop mouthing and listen to what I have to say.
sentences.chinese: 別再裝腔作勢，好好聽聽我說的話。

sentences.english: it's a kind of feminized, mincing approach to the novel.
sentences.chinese: 是一種女性化，裝腔作勢地接近小說。

sentences.english: She loves to pose when men are around.
sentences.chinese: 當有男人在四周時她喜歡裝腔作勢，故作姿態。

sentences.english: Unlike most Spanish bosses, Mr Roig doesn't mince his words.
sentences.chinese: 與西班牙大多數的老闆不同，羅伊先生不會裝腔作勢。

sentences.english: In New Testament times, the Pharisees were pros at pretentious prayers.
sentences.chinese: 在新約時代，法利賽人專愛裝腔作勢的禱告。
